name: DatastoreClient
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient
description: Each RPC normalizes the partition IDs of the keys in its input entities, and always returns entities with keys with normalized partition IDs. This applies to all keys and entities, including those in values, except keys with both an empty path and an empty or unset partition ID. Normalization of input keys sets the project ID (if not already set) to the project ID from the request.

params.name: service_path
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: channel
params.description: A Channel object through which to make calls.

params.name: chan_creds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore/v1/datastore_client"

DatastoreClient = Google::Cloud::Datastore::V1::DatastoreClient
ReadOptions = Google::Datastore::V1::ReadOptions

datastore_client = DatastoreClient.new
project_id = ''
read_options = ReadOptions.new
keys = []
response = datastore_client.lookup(project_id, read_options, keys)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: read_options
params.description: The options for this lookup request.

params.name: keys
params.description: Keys of entities to look up.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore/v1/datastore_client"

DatastoreClient = Google::Cloud::Datastore::V1::DatastoreClient
PartitionId = Google::Datastore::V1::PartitionId
ReadOptions = Google::Datastore::V1::ReadOptions

datastore_client = DatastoreClient.new
project_id = ''
partition_id = PartitionId.new
read_options = ReadOptions.new
response = datastore_client.run_query(project_id, partition_id, read_options)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: partition_id
params.description:
Entities are partitioned into subsets, identified by a partition ID.
Queries are scoped to a single partition.
This partition ID is normalized with the standard default context
partition ID.

params.name: read_options
params.description: The options for this query.

params.name: query
params.description: The query to run.

params.name: gql_query
params.description: The GQL query to run.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore/v1/datastore_client"

DatastoreClient = Google::Cloud::Datastore::V1::DatastoreClient

datastore_client = DatastoreClient.new
project_id = ''
response = datastore_client.begin_transaction(project_id)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: commit
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient#commit
methods.description: Commits a transaction, optionally creating, deleting or modifying some entities.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore/v1/datastore_client"

DatastoreClient = Google::Cloud::Datastore::V1::DatastoreClient
Mode = Google::Datastore::V1::CommitRequest::Mode

datastore_client = DatastoreClient.new
project_id = ''
mode = Mode::MODE_UNSPECIFIED
mutations = []
response = datastore_client.commit(project_id, mode, mutations)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: mode
params.description: The type of commit to perform. Defaults to +TRANSACTIONAL+.

params.name: mutations
params.description:
The mutations to perform.

When mode is +TRANSACTIONAL+, mutations affecting a single entity are applied in order. The following sequences of mutations affecting a single entity are not permitted in a single +Commit+ request:

  • +insert+ followed by +insert+
  • +update+ followed by +insert+
  • +upsert+ followed by +insert+
  • +delete+ followed by +update+

When mode is +NON_TRANSACTIONAL+, no two mutations may affect a single entity.

params.name: transaction
params.description:
The identifier of the transaction associated with the commit. A
transaction identifier is returned by a call to
Datastore::BeginTransaction.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore/v1/datastore_client"

DatastoreClient = Google::Cloud::Datastore::V1::DatastoreClient

datastore_client = DatastoreClient.new
project_id = ''
transaction = ''
response = datastore_client.rollback(project_id, transaction)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: transaction
params.description:
The transaction identifier, returned by a call to
Datastore::BeginTransaction.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: allocate_ids
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient#allocate_ids
methods.description: Allocates IDs for the given keys, which is useful for referencing an entity before it is inserted.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore/v1/datastore_client"

DatastoreClient = Google::Cloud::Datastore::V1::DatastoreClient

datastore_client = DatastoreClient.new
project_id = ''
keys = []
response = datastore_client.allocate_ids(project_id, keys)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: keys
params.description:
A list of keys with incomplete key paths for which to allocate IDs.
No key may be reserved/read-only.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.
